title: What are some examples of 1970s rock music? - Quora

response.answer_text: First, I’m gonna switch this up just a touch with what are some of the best rock Songs of the 70s that nobody ever talks about but are every bit as awesome as the well known classics everyone’s listing. Moon In June - Soft Machine (1970) (I Know I’m) Losing You - Rod Stewart (1971) Can’t You Hear Me Knocking - The Rolling Stones (1971) Death May Be Your Santa Claus - Mott The Hoople (1971) No Harm - Faust (1972) Listen To The Lion - Van Morrison (1972) Too Much Time - Captain Beefheart (1972) I’m In Love With A Girl - Big Star (1974) Gloria - Patti Smith (1975) Borrowed Tune - Neil Young (1975) Rock n Roll - Lou Reed - the 10 minute live version from Rock and Roll Animal (1974) Just Something You’re Going Through - Graham Parker (1976) I Fall - The Damned (1977) Annie - Pete Townshend and Ronnie Lane (1977) Lipstick Vogue - Elvis Costello (1978) Let The Good Times Roll - The Cars (1978) Here Comes The Flood - Alternate Gabriel Version from Robert Fripp’s Exposure (1979) Tattoo Love Boys - The Pretenders (1979) But those nuggets aside, if we’re really talking best songs of the 70s overall, my personal top 10 would include Anarchy In The UK - The Sex Pistols Search And Destroy - The Stooges What’s Goin On - Marvin Gaye Heroes - David Bowie Family Affair - Sly And The Family Stone Won’t Get Fooled Again - The Who Teenage Lobotomy - The Ramones Pink Moon - Nick Drake Walk On The Wild Side - Lou Reed I’m In Love With A Girl - Big Star

Some of the best rock songs of the ‘70s . . ? There are no best. There are only the ones you loved. These are some of the outstanding .. okay *sigh* .. “best” .. songs of the ’70s that I loved, that had special meaning in my life. In no particular order: 25 or 6 to 4 .. Chicago The first time I heard this amazing song my best friend Joannie and I had just walked into her house from school. Her big brother was playing the album on the console stereo (!) It made me stop dead in my tracks. Those horns! That spectacular guitar! To this day it's my favorite Chicago song. Thanks, Dave Grable. … and Color My World . . . My first wedding song. Me, 15 and six months pregnant. Him, 17 and .. dazed. But both of us with hope . . . These Eyes & She's Come Undone/No Sugar Tonight .. The Guess Who One of the greatest vocalists of the ‘70s, Burton Cummings. Randy Bachman on guitar .. What's not to love? These guys meant more to me and my first husband than any other band. Wild World .. Cat Stevens This song makes me ache with nostalgia. Cat's album Tea for the Tillerman saw me through many nights as a young and lonely Army wife. Shine On You Crazy Diamond .. Pink Floyd In my humble opinion, the epitome of blues/rock songs. Their aching and soulful tribute to lost friend and band mate Syd Barrett. I listen to this song with my ears between the speakers and candles burning … It's like a sacred ritual. It puts me in the zone. Fire on High .. Electric Light Orchestra This song has only three words: the ones of the title. But the music is epic. ELO is the first band I saw in concert, 1976. Opening was this band below with their equally epic: Love is the Drug .. Roxy Music Sensual, silky-voiced Bryan Ferry had me the minute he walked onstage. A most underrated vocalist. The musicianship of this band - and this song - are outstanding. Nothing beats a sexy sax. Bridge of Sighs .. Robin Trower The bright, neon green 8-track tape (!) … All my little brother's friends wanted to borrow it. There's not a bad song on the entire album. And here's another spectacular vocalist, James Dewar. Robin Trower is (maybe) my favorite guitarist ... if I had to choose. But, I don't have to choose … so I'm not going to. Cities on Flame with Rock and Roll .. Blue Oyster Cult Uh, YEAH! .. And so was Buck Dharma's guitar. One must listen to this song … loudly. It's a prerequisite. I saw them in 1978. Lasers (when they weren't yet prominent), the music, and the first (and only!) time I went against my better judgement and tried purple mescaline .. made for a memorable experience. Don't try this at home. Hallucinations are scary. “ .. my ears will melt and then my eyes …” Still one of the greatest rock and roll songs ever. Aqualung & Locomotive Breath .. Jethro Tull Martin Barr’s guitar, Ian Anderson's voice, and .. flute? It just worked, .. and rocked. Beautifully. One of the best shows I've seen - these guys at the Fox Theater in Detroit. Kashmir .. Led Zeppelin My favorite Zeppelin song was, of course, Stairway to Heaven until the double album Physical Graffiti came out. I was blown away by this song. It has my favorite John Bonham drum work and Robert Plant vocals. There are many, many more I could name but I'll stop now. .. “So let the girl .. let that girl rock and roll …”
